titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I wrote a sermon for the Freemasons taking occasion to urge them to cooperate in forming public opinion in support of the effort to restrain publication of Divorce Trials. I went in to Durham & lunched in the Castle with the two Archdeacons & Clayton. After lunch I discussed some matters of diocesan business with them, and then motored to Stockton, where I confirmed a consumptive girl, & had interviews with Douglas and Purvis on the subject of the Commission on Church Extension in that town. Then I returned to Auckland, where I found that General Kirkpatrick with his wife and two daughters had arrived. He leaves England next Friday to take up his command in Quetta.
